timeline.author: OlegMazurov

timeline.bodyText:
The reason we redundantly check if Debug/Trace levels are enabled outside the logging methods is to avoid argument evaluation which is done unconditionally and may have quite noticeable overhead.
Introducing an intermediate convenience method apparently defeats the purpose.
The existing trace() method doesn't conform to that principle and should be reworked (separately from this PR; also to use Logger). It should not be considered as acceptable still.
timeline.author: OlegMazurov

replies.author: hatyo

timeline.bodyText: Use LOG.debug(message, error). It will also print the error.getMessage() and the stack trace.
timeline.author: OlegMazurov

timeline.bodyText: Use LOG. Ideally we'll have just one logging system and it won't be the Derby one.
timeline.author: OlegMazurov

replies.bodyText:
Yes, that's definitely something we should do, I didn't want to introduce that here because I thought it is out of scope. Will should at least have a JIRA for tracking this.
For now, I would prefer to keep it like this, because the error will appear anyway (although in a different log file).
